result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarvae A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge. Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION AND NO NEW CRIMES, THE COURT WILL GRANT EXPUNGEMENT.

- Perform 30 hours of community service.
- AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $162.00 entered as ordered by the court on 07/16/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 12/01/15. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and forwarded to the Clerk's office.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.; lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jarvae A Smith in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Scott Phillips  for attorney Jason Canfield.
Appointing Attorney Jason Canfield signed and filed.

Defendant Jarvae A Smith in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Indigency hearing conducted.  Court finds defendant qualifies for representation at county expense and has the ability to repay the county at the rate of $50.00 per month upon conclusion of this matter.  Court appoints Attorney Jason Canfield.  Telephone call to Attorney Canfield who accepts the appointment.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jarvae A Smith in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 24.vb
